File proofs must be approved in order for the files to be publicly available for download or purchase. Proofs can be downloaded and viewed externally by clicking the proof document title, and can be approved by checking the box next to the proof title and clicking Approve Proofs.
Select the review attachments for the author to see
Select revisions to use in the next stage
Select fair copy files for production.
Submission has been resubmitted for review.
You are about to initiate a review for this submission. Files that are part of the submission are listed below and can be selected for review.

You are about to create a new review round for this submission. Files that have not been used in other review rounds are listed below. By default, the reviewers from the previous review round have been selected to participate in this new review round.
Any revisions uploaded here will be available for use in further stages.

Any files that have already been uploaded to any submission stage (even Editorial or Production) can be chosen for review by checking the Include checkbox below and clicking Search: all available files will be listed and can be chosen for inclusion. Additional files not already uploaded to a stage can be added to this listing by clicking the Upload Review File link.

Any submission files that were chosen for inclusion in this review round are available below. Additional review files can be uploaded (and current files replaced) by clicking the Manage Review Files link. Any files that are listed here will be available to assigned reviewers.

Reviewers can be assigned to this submission by clicking the Add Reviewer link. Reviewers can be contacted, and their due dates revised, by clicking the comment next to their name. You will be notified of completed reviews. When a review is complete, it can be accessed by clicking the reviewer's name.
Include all files from all accessible workflow stages.

Any files that have already been uploaded to any submission stage can be added to the Final Draft Files listing by checking the Include checkbox below and clicking Search: all available files will be listed and can be chosen for inclusion. Additional files not already uploaded to a stage can be added to the listing by clicking the Upload A Final Draft link.

To add a participant to this stage of the submission, select a user group from the drop-down menu, then add a user.

Note: The user will be added to all stages for which this user group is assigned.
You are about to remove this participant from all stages. If the user also have pending auditor tasks, they will be removed too.
You must select a user group.
You must select a user for the specified user group.

The copyeditor downloads the Accepted Submission files for copyediting, and then uploads the copyedited files under Copyediting for review. The copyeditor uses Assign to select and notify users to audit copyedits. Those assigned download, review, and upload the copyedited files and/or leave a note with the file. The copyeditor then prepares and uploads a clean Fair Copy of the submission file(s), for which an editor signs off and clicks Send to Production.
All approved submission revisions from previous review stages are available below. New draft files can be uploaded (and current files replaced) by clicking the Manage Final Draft Files link.

Copyedited files may be uploaded here. Once uploaded, Authors and other participants assigned to the submission may be asked to audit the uploaded copyediting file(s) by clicking the Assign button. Multiple files may be sent for auditing, and an auditing due date can be set. You will be notified of completed audits, and can access the audits by clicking on the participant's name. Finally, you will be able to sign off as copyeditor on the audited copyedit file.
Final copyedited files may be uploaded to the Fair Copy section, at which point the submission (and any uploaded fair copies) can be sent to the Production stage.

All approved and copyedited submission files from the Editorial stage are available in the Production Ready section. Different formats (digital, hardback, paperback/softback) can be configured for this submission in the Publication Formats section. The submission is considered complete when the Catalog Entry metadata has been approved, and all Publication Formats checklist items are marked complete.

All approved and copyedited submission files from the Editorial stage are available here. New production ready files can be uploaded (and current files replaced) by clicking Upload a Production Ready File.

Different publication formats, such as hardcover, softcover and digital, can be uploaded in the Publication Formats section below. You can use the publication formats grid below as a checklist for what still needs to be done to publish a publication format.

Add one or more publication formats (eg. hardback; softback/paperback; digital; audio) here. Upload final galley proofs for each publication format below, and audit and approve them. For the galley to be listed in the public catalog, approve the Catalog Entry metadata and ensure that each format checklist item has been completed.

The assigned editor manages all available files for review from the Review Files section, and assigns one or more reviewers to the files from the Reviewers section. New review rounds can be initiated by clicking the New Review Round tab. All reviewer, author and editor revisions for this review stage are managed in the Revisions section. The editor must finally choose from among the available decisions (Request Revisions; Resubmit for Review; Accept for Submission; Decline Submission; External Review) to advance the submission.
